segments.text: You are married to a foreigner , huh ? So what ’ s it like ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , the first year of our marriage , we had great difficulty getting along . The things that are important to me are not important to him . We had a lot of conflicts .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yeah , I know what you mean . The first year of any marriage is difficult for all couples , not to mention two people from different cultures .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: And now we have a two-year-old boy . We ’ re very happy that he ’ s healthy and smart .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , so he ’ s half Chinese and half American . That ’ s unusual . What languages does he speak , then ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Right now he speaks mostly Chinese , and he can say a few English words . But he will learn .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What does he look like ? Can people tell ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , people surely can . He ’ s whiter than the Chinese kids , and his hair is a little blonde . My husband says his eyes are very Chinese though .
segments.speaker: S2
